decision_conditions: The Oak is situated at the bottom of the rear garden of 1 Broadwood Avenue. The tree represents a prominent landscape feature for the residents of both Broadwood Avenue and the adjacent properties of St Edmunds Avenue. The Oak presents a mature and attractive crown which greatly contributes to the arboreal and wooded character of the area. The tree is also comprised within the area of mature protected trees providing a natural gradient of mature tree cover towards Ruislip Woods National Nature Reserve. The tree provides great benefits in amenity and biodiversity of the area which are both present and future because the Oak has the potential for long-life expectancy.

The tree appears to be in good health with a symmetrical, natural-looking crown. The Oak does not appear to have been pruned before and does not present signs of dieback or major deadwood within the crown.
